title: Developing Online Instructional Design Expertise: Asynchronous Learning and Community of Practice Building

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with online learning and grasp of fundamental instructional design concepts
context.additional_context: Flexible learning schedules for office/administrative professionals, applied to language education

learning_goals: Learners achieve over 80% completion rates by designing LMS-based asynchronous learning objects (videos, quizzes, readings).
Learners share instructional design improvement plans based on peer feedback in an online community of practice at least three times.

Based on monthly formative assessments (3-question feedback surveys, 2-item peer evaluations) over six months, learners write self-assessment reports on design competencies meeting ≥4 of 5 rubric criteria

resources: Asynchronous Learning Authoring Tool (Canva, Articulate, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
